  <hr> 
  <h2> Package java.math </h2> Provides classes for performing arbitrary-precision integer arithmetic (
  <code>BigInteger</code>) and arbitrary-precision decimal arithmetic (
  <code>BigDecimal</code>). 
  <p> <b>See:</b> <br> &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href="#package_description"><b>Description</b></a> </p>
  <p> </p>
  <table border="1" width="100%" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" summary=""> 
   <tbody>
    <tr bgcolor="#CCCCFF" class="TableHeadingColor"> 
     <th align="left" colspan="2"><font size="+2"> <b>Class Summary</b></font></th> 
    </tr> 
    <tr bgcolor="white" class="TableRowColor"> 
     <td width="15%"><b><a href="../../java/math/BigDecimal.html" title="class in java.math">BigDecimal</a></b></td> 
     <td>Immutable, arbitrary-precision signed decimal numbers.</td> 
    </tr> 
    <tr bgcolor="white" class="TableRowColor"> 
     <td width="15%"><b><a href="../../java/math/BigInteger.html" title="class in java.math">BigInteger</a></b></td> 
     <td>Immutable arbitrary-precision integers.</td> 
    </tr> 
    <tr bgcolor="white" class="TableRowColor"> 
     <td width="15%"><b><a href="../../java/math/MathContext.html" title="class in java.math">MathContext</a></b></td> 
     <td>Immutable objects which encapsulate the context settings which describe certain rules for numerical operators, such as those implemented by the <a href="../../java/math/BigDecimal.html" title="class in java.math"><code>BigDecimal</code></a> class.</td> 
    </tr> 
   </tbody>
  </table> &nbsp; 
  <p> </p>
  <table border="1" width="100%" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0" summary=""> 
   <tbody>
    <tr bgcolor="#CCCCFF" class="TableHeadingColor">

    </tr> 
    <tr bgcolor="white" class="TableRowColor"> 
     <td width="15%"><b><a href="../../java/math/RoundingMode.html" title="enum in java.math">RoundingMode</a></b></td> 
     <td>Specifies a <i>rounding behavior</i> for numerical operations capable of discarding precision.</td> 
    </tr> 
   </tbody>
  </table> &nbsp; 
  <p> <a name="package_description">
    <!-- --></a></p>
  <h2> Package java.math Description </h2> 
  <p> Provides classes for performing arbitrary-precision integer arithmetic (<code>BigInteger</code>) and arbitrary-precision decimal arithmetic (<code>BigDecimal</code>). <code>BigInteger</code> is analogous to the primitive integer types except that it provides arbitrary precision, hence operations on <code>BigInteger</code>s do not overflow or lose precision. In addition to standard arithmetic operations, <code>BigInteger</code> provides modular arithmetic, GCD calculation, primality testing, prime generation, bit manipulation, and a few other miscellaneous operations. <code>BigDecimal</code> provides arbitrary-precision signed decimal numbers suitable for currency calculations and the like. <code>BigDecimal</code> gives the user complete control over rounding behavior, allowing the user to choose from a comprehensive set of eight rounding modes. </p>
  <p> </p>
  <p> </p>
  <dl> 
   <dt>
    <b>Since:</b>
   </dt> 
   <dd>
    JDK1.1
   </dd> 
  </dl>
